Does anyone know if it's possible to "cache" authentication tokens in custom cards? or even update the HubSpot secrets from the code?

I have a custom card that makes an api call to load data on the card, but the bearer tokens I can generate only last 1 hour, so I can't store it in my HubSpot app secrets.

But everytime the user loads a new page, it gets a new token to make that call which can stress my api provider.

Curious if anyone has dealt with something similar.

Tagging <@U01QVR44MEY> because I feel like he would know :joy:

Hi Kobe,

If you just want to cache the token from your api provider, to be available from your app serverless function, you could use something like <https://www.gomomento.com/|gomomento>, very easy to setup and super fast, get the token from cache until expired and when expired, then get a new token update cache, do your calls.
:slightly_smiling_face:
